title: Executing formatters test suite fails
body:
```
$ bundle exec bin/rspec spec/rspec/core/formatters
/home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/spec/rspec/core/formatters/helpers_spec.rb:4: uninitialized constant RSpec::Core::Formatters (NameError)
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/configuration.rb:386:in `load'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/configuration.rb:386:in `load_spec_files'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/configuration.rb:386:in `map'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/configuration.rb:386:in `load_spec_files'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/command_line.rb:18:in `run'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/runner.rb:55:in `run_in_process'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/runner.rb:46:in `run'
    from /home/vondruch/fedora-reviews/rubygem-rspec-core/BUILDROOT/rubygem-rspec-core-2.5.1-1.fc14.x86_64/usr/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/rspec-core-2.5.1/lib/rspec/core/runner.rb:10:in `autorun'
    from bin/rspec:4
```

This might be fixed using
    RUBYOPT="Ilib rlib/rspec/core/formatters/base_formatter.rb" bundle exec bin/rspec spec
but that is unnecessary workaround
